member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.Configuration.Files
member.summary: Collection of objects that compose the Microsoft CI configuration. There must be at least one file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.ConfigurationCreationContext.LanguageTag
member.summary: An IETF BCP-47 language tag designating how template data should be localized.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.ConfigurationCreationContext.Answers
member.summary: The answers to interview questions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.ConfigurationFile.Content
member.summary: The content of the file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.ConfigurationFile.Path
member.summary: The full path of the file, relative to the root of the repository.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.ConfigurationFile.IsBase64Encoded
member.summary: Indicates if the content is base64 encoded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.CreatePipelineConnectionInputs
member.summary: This class is used to create a pipeline connection within the team project provided. If the team project does not exist, it will be created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.CreatePipelineConnectionInputs.ProviderId
member.summary: The external source provider id for which the connection is being made.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.CreatePipelineConnectionInputs.RedirectUrl
member.summary: If provided, this will be the URL returned with the PipelineConnection. This will override any other redirect URL that would have been generated for the connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.CreatePipelineConnectionInputs.RequestSource
member.summary: Where the request to create the pipeline originated (such as 'GitHub Marketplace' or 'Azure DevOps')

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.CreatePipelineConnectionInputs.Project
member.summary: The team project settings for an existing team project or for a new team project.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.CreatePipelineConnectionInputs.ProviderData
member.summary: This dictionary contains information that is specific to the provider. This data is opaque to the rest of the Pipelines infrastructure and does NOT contribute to the resources Token. The format of the string and its contents depend on the implementation of the provider.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.DetectedBuildFramework.Id
member.summary: The unique identifier of the build framework.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.DetectedBuildFramework.Version
member.summary: The version of the framework if it can be determined from the sources.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.DetectedBuildFramework.Settings
member.summary: Additional detected settings for the build framework.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.DetectedBuildFramework.BuildTargets
member.summary: List of build targets discovered for the framework to act upon.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.PipelineConnection.AccountId
member.summary: The account id that contains the team project for the connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.PipelineConnection.TeamProjectId
member.summary: The team project that contains the definition for the connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.PipelineConnection.ServiceEndpointId
member.summary: The service endpoint that was created for the connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.PipelineConnection.DefinitionId
member.summary: The definition id that was created for the connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.PipelineConnection.RedirectUrl
member.summary: This is the URL that the user should be taken to in order to continue setup.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.RepositoryAnalysis.Languages
member.summary: A set of languages that exist in the repository and their usage percentage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.PipelinesHttpClient.GetConfigurationsAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets a list of existing configuration files for the given repository.
member.param: Project ID or project name
The type of the repository such as GitHub, TfsGit (i.e. Azure Repos), Bitbucket, etc.
The vendor-specific identifier or the name of the repository, e.g. Microsoft/vscode (GitHub) or e9d82045-ddba-4e01-a63d-2ab9f040af62 (Azure Repos)
The repository branch where to look for the configuration file.
If specified, the ID of the service endpoint to query. Can only be omitted for providers that do not use service endpoints, e.g. TfsGit (i.e. Azure Repos).
The cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.PipelinesHttpClient.GetConfigurationsAsync(System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)

The repository branch where to look for the configuration file.
If specified, the ID of the service endpoint to query. Can only be omitted for providers that do not use service endpoints, e.g. TfsGit (i.e. Azure Repos).

member.summary: LEGACY METHOD - Obsolete Creates a new Pipeline connection between the provider installation and the specified project. Returns an Operation object that holds the redirect Url
member.param: The cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.PipelinesHttpClient.CreateProjectConnectionAsync(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Pipelines.WebApi.CreatePipelineConnectionInputs,System.String,System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a new Pipeline connection between the provider installation and the specified project. Returns the PipelineConnection object created.
member.param: The cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.summary: Returns a list of build frameworks that best match the given repository based on its contents.

The type of the repository such as GitHub, TfsGit (i.e. Azure Repos), Bitbucket, etc.

The repository branch to detect build frameworks for.
If specified, the ID of the service endpoint to query. Can only be omitted for providers that do not use service endpoints, e.g. TfsGit (i.e. Azure Repos).
The cancellation token to cancel operation.
